intro: Hilliella alatipes, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
